array.string: Get a random note using `randomInt(from: 0, to: 23)`.
If a note sounds too loud, you can add the optional `volume` parameter:\ `playInstrument(.piano, note: 14, volume: 40)`

dict.string: `let note = randomInt(from: 0, to: 23)`\ `if graphic.text == "🍐" {`\ ` playInstrument(.piano, note: note)`\ `}`\ `if graphic.text == "🍋" {`\ ` playInstrument(.electricGuitar, note: note)`\ `}` `if graphic.text == "🍊" {`\ ` playInstrument(.cosmicDrums, note: note)`\ `}`

### Well done! You’re getting the hang of playing notes.
Before moving on, have some fun experimenting with the different instruments and notes.
